results.title: The Art of piano
results.creator_credit: Ideale Audience, IMG Artists, La Sept-Arte, Pierre-Olivier Bardet, Stephen Wright and Donald Sturrock
results.brief_description: The Art of Piano features some the greatest concert pianists of the Twentieth Century playing the greatest music ever written for piano. The documentary follows the development of the profession of concert pianists from the turn of the 19th Century, beginning with Franz Liszt up until the 1970s and compares the various interpretive styles of these great musicians. Excerpts of actual footage of performances by concert pianists are interspersed with interviews with contemporary pianists, and conductors or fellow performers. Essential viewing for anyone studying piano or lovers of piano music. Includes footage of Ignace Jan Paderewski, Josef Hofmann, Sergei Rachmaninoff, Benno Moisewitsch, Vladimir Horowitz, Gyorgy Cziffra, Myra Hess, Artur Rubenstein, Annie Fischer, Francis Plante, Alfred Cortot, Wilhelm Backhaus, Edwin Fischer, Emil Gilels, Sviatoslav Richter, Arturo Benedetti Michelangeli, Glenn Gould and Claudio Arrau.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ideale Audience, IMG Artists, La Sept-Arte, Pierre-Olivier Bardet, Stephen Wright and Donald Sturrock

results.title: The Art of negotiating (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Rank Audio Visual, Ian Latimer and Jeff Inman
results.brief_description: This film is designed to teach the four main phases which occur during the negotiation process in a commercial or business setting: preparation, discussion, proposals and bargaining. Through the use of a clever analogy between domestic and work situations, this film shows how all negotiations ultimately come down to a question of civilised bargaining.

results.title: The Art of meditation
results.creator_credit: Hartley Productions, Films For a New Age and Irving Hartley
results.brief_description: Alan Watts discusses the art of meditation as an alternative to the pressures and frustration of modern life. The film brings him right into the midst of the viewing audience who can follow along as he leads them step by step in the disciplines of body posture, breath control and concentration, toward that state of relaxation that stops “the chattering in the skull”. The film does not set forth the principles of meditation in academic fashion, it is experiential, leaving one with a feeling of peace and well-being.

results.title: The Art of low fat cooking
results.creator_credit: Video Distributors International and Andrew McDonald
results.brief_description: This video looks at ways people should reduce added fats, both in cooking and food preparation. It promotes a healthy lifestyle using the “diet pyramid” as a guide. It also explores ways to reduce fats found naturally in foods and encourages alternative food selections. Presented by Gabriel Gate for the International Diabetes Institute in co-operation with Life Be In It.

results.title: The Art of it
results.brief_description: The Australian Youth Orchestra, under conductor John Hopkins, is seen at rehearsal and in a concert performance of Benjamin Britten’s ” Young Person’s Guide to the Orchestra”.

results.title: The Art of ise paper patterns
results.brief_description: The patterns of the Japanese Kimono consist of woven or dyed patterns. Most of the dye patterns have been manufactured by traditional ways of carefully prepared pattern paper. Shown is the outstanding technique of Japanese pattern paper engraving. No other credits available.

results.title: The Art of hockey umpiring
results.brief_description: A detailed examination of the rules of men’s hockey including such pre match responsibilities of the umpire as personal equipment, dress, ground markings and the extent of the playing area under is jurisdiction. An investigation into common infringements of the rules as seen in context with the game. No other credits available.

results.title: The Art of French cooking
results.creator_credit: R&H Media Productions and Bob Bailey
results.brief_description: A film adaptation of Fernande Garvin’s best selling cookbook. Five famous recipes, using simple ingredients are demonstrated in easy to follow detail. Emphasizes the love and care lavished on ingredients in French cuisine. French toast sandwiches, French onion soup, fish fillets in sauce, beef bourguignon, and cherries jubilee are the featured dishes.

results.title: The Art of eating
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Douglas Jackson and Ian McLaren
results.brief_description: The film, a visual and gustatory delight, mixes humour with superb food and takes us into the banquet hall where le Club Prosper Montagne, regarded as North America’s most knowledgeable gastronomic society, is holding its biannual dinner. It also takes us into the kitchen where Chef Marcel Kretz is coordinating this delicate event.
